{"step_by_step_thinking": "Causal prophylaxis refers to the use of drugs to prevent the development of clinical disease by targeting the pre-erythrocytic stages of the malaria parasite. These stages occur before the parasite infects red blood cells. Therefore, the antimalarial drugs used for causal prophylaxis act at the pre-erythrocytic schizogony stage of the developmental cycle.", "answer_choice": "C"}
